alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 08 at 2:58PM AKST until January 10 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TUESDAY NIGHT TO NOON AKST WEDNESDAY FOR NUNIVAK ISLAND AND THE KUSKOKWIM DELTA COAST... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Visibility reduced to one quarter mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. East to southeast winds gusting 25 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Nunivak Island and the Kuskokwim Delta Coast. * WHEN...From midnight Tuesday night to noon AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult travel conditions. Widespread blowing snow will produce white-out conditions at times. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will warm through the morning hours on Wednesday with an eventual transition from snow to rain, especially along the Kuskokwim Bay coast on up to Bethel. There is a chance of freezing rain during the transition.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
